dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 428 IH: Protecting the Dignity of Unborn Children Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Latta (for himself, Mr. Banks, Mr. Allen, Mr. Duncan, and Mr. Balderson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the unlawful disposal of fetal remains.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting the Dignity of Unborn Children Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibiting unlawful disposal of fetal remains
section.text: Part I of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Whoever recklessly disposes of or abandons fetal remains in a landfill or in any of the navigable waters of the United States shall be imprisoned not more than 3 years or fined under this title, or both.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize the prosecution of any woman for the disposal of the remains of her unborn child.

paragraph.text: The term fetal remains means any part of a human fetus that is deceased by reason of an abortion, but does not include any such part that has been cremated.
The term landfill means a sanitary landfill, as such term is defined in section 1004(26) of the Solid Waste Disposal Act.
The term navigable waters has the meaning given such term in section 502(7) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act.
